security: Disclosing payment details, cover names, and financial channels could expose sensitive operational methods and compromise individuals involved in covert activities. Quoting directly: 'The check, drawn on (Ashsead, Hanifori Associates...was cleared and left with Cover Division.'
summary: A memo detailing the final payment of $650 to Bivard G. Tichborn following his Cuban trip, processed through Finance and Cover channels.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated April 25, 1960, documents the processing of Bivard G. Tichborn's final salary payment of $650.00 upon completion of his Cuban assignment. The payment was managed through appropriate Finance and Cover channels, with the check drawn on Ashmead, Haniford Associates and cleared before being left with Cover Division on April 22, 1960, for forwarding to Tichborn's California bank via Ashmead, Haniford Associates in Philadelphia.
title: Payment to Bivard G. Tichborn (P)
